data.title: Kunlavut and Pornpawee march into quarter-finals
data.description: Kunlavut Vitidsarn booked his berth in the men

data.title: Beetles terminate coach Moro's contract
data.description: Chiang Rai United have parted ways with their Spanish coach Xabi Moro after a string of poor results.

data.title: Tour Finals out of reach for Ratchanok
data.description: Thailand women

data.title: IFMA taps Worawi for an advisory role
data.description: The International Federation of Muaythai Associations (IFMA) has appointed former Football Association of Thailand (FAT) president Worawi Makudi as a member of its Advisory Council.

data.title: Stephen Irvine believes KO ‘failure’ cost him ONE Championship contract, vows to return
data.description: Stephen Irvine put the blame squarely on his shoulders for not securing a ONE Championship contract last week, but “El Matador” has vowed to get the job done next time out.

data.title: Tears flow as fans salute retiring Nadal after Davis Cup defeat
data.description: MALAGA, Spain: Rafael Nadal said farewell to tennis and his fans saluted their retiring hero in a bittersweet and emotional ceremony at a sold-out Malaga arena following his last professional match in Spain’s 2-1 Davis Cup defeat to the Netherlands on Tuesday.

data.title: Master the 3 C's, your key to glory
data.description: From the feedback received it seems like the psychological side of the game is perhaps the most important area of golf that requires a golfer

data.title: Large field expected for Asian road meet
data.description: More than 30 nations are expected to participate in the 2025  Asian Road Cycling Championships  in Thailand.

data.title: Wilde and Waugh are victorious
data.description: Phuket: New Zealand

data.title: Ishii says Thai team need improvement
data.description: Thailand were held to a second draw in as many matches when Laos secured a 1-1 tie at Thammasat Stadium on Sunday night, but War Elephants coach Masatada Ishii said he will be keeping faith with the same squad for the next month

data.title: ONE Championship: Jacob Smith insists Rodtang elbow ‘changed the fight’, vows to return for title
data.description: Jacob Smith vowed to return for the ONE Championship flyweight Muay Thai title after admitting an elbow from Rodtang Jitmuangnon “changed the fight”.

data.title: ONE Championship: Mahmoudi wants to fight Rodtang for vacant title with win over Puric
data.description: Elias Mahmoudi believes his fight with Denis Puric should be a title eliminator for the vacant ONE Championship flyweight Muay Thai belt.

data.title: A historic day for Suteepat in Taiwan
data.description: Taipei: Suteepat Prateeptienchai became the first player to successfully defend a title on the Asian Tour in seven years when he claimed the US$400,000 Taiwan Glass Taifong Open in Taiwan on Sunday after the closest of finishes.

data.title: New Thai duo claims first badminton title
data.description: New pairing Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran claimed their first title together after winning the US$420,000 BWF Kumamoto Masters Japan on Sunday.

data.title: War Elephants all ready to battle Laos in friendly
data.description: Thailand will take on Laos in the second  Fifa Day  friendly match at Thammasat Stadium Sunday night.

data.title: Suteepat and new-boy Runchanapong in front
data.description: Taipei: Thailand

data.title: Thai duo target first title
data.description: New pairing Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran will vie for their first title together after reaching the mixed doubles final of the US$420,000 BWF Kumamoto Masters in Japan Saturday.

data.title: ONE Championship contract eludes Stephen Irvine despite win at ONE Friday Fights 87
data.description: Stephen Irvine was left waiting on a ONE Championship contract again despite racking up his fifth win at ONE Lumpinee on Friday night in Bangkok.

data.title: Paul beats Tyson as former heavyweight champ cannot turn back clock
data.description: ARLINGTON, Texas — Jake Paul beat boxing legend Mike Tyson by unanimous decision to win an intergenerational heavyweight battle in Texas, the United States, on Friday that failed to live up to its enormous hype.

data.title: ONE Championship’s Ben Tynan serving 12-month ban for positive drugs test, source says
data.description: Sources close to the situation have confirmed that ONE Championship heavyweight MMA contender Ben Tynan is serving a 12-month ban for a positive drugs test.

data.title: Coote videos could have bad ramifications for refs
data.description: Making the news this week for all the wrong reasons has been Premier League referee David Coote who was suspended after a video surfaced of him appearing to make disparaging comments about former Liverpool manager Juergen Klopp.

data.title: Suteepat one shot adrift at Taifong Open
data.description: Taipei: Defending champion Suteepat Prateeptienchai is one off shot the pace heading into the weekend rounds at the US$400,000 Taifong Open.

data.title: New-look War Elephants settle for draw
data.description: A national squad featuring the new generation of War Elephants suffered a goalless home draw with Lebanon in a Fifa Day friendly on Thursday night at Thammasat Stadium.

data.title: Thai aces keep title hopes alive
data.description: Pornpawee Chochuwong and mixed doubles pair Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran advanced to the semi-finals of the US$420,000 BWF Kumamoto Masters Japan on Friday.

data.title: ONE Championship: Jo Nattawut returns vs Bampara Kouyate at ONE 170 in Bangkok
data.description: Fan favourite “Smokin’” Jo Nattawut will return to ONE Championship action against Bampara Kouyate, a source told the Bangkok Post.

data.title: ONE Championship announces two title fights for January’s ONE Fight Night 27 card
data.description: ONE Championship has announced two big title fights will headline its ONE Fight Night 27 card on January 11 in Bangkok.

data.title: Jarred Brooks begins ‘climbing Everest’ in bid for ONE Championship flyweight title with Reece McLaren matchup
data.description: Jarred Brooks will begin his bid to become a two-division champion in ONE Championship when he takes on Reece McLaren next month at ONE Fight Night 27.

data.title: Runchanapong, Thompson                         share lead at Taifong Open
data.description: Taipei: Thailand

data.title: Local stars in with a chance to shine at LPGA Thailand again
data.description: Honda is set to bring global golf excitement to Thailand once again as the prestigious Honda LPGA Thailand 2025 will take place between Feb 20-23 at the iconic Siam Country Club, Old Course, in Pattaya next year.
